The apartments buildings are ageing a little, and we found the plumbing a bit tempramental and the lights flickered when you turned the AC on. However, the place was clean, bed comfortable and bathroom came with a bundle of lovely toiletries. The swimming pool area is lovely, and we were told it had recently been refurbished. The pool is unheated, but in the height of the summer at least, the water was positively warm. Great place for a refreshing dip and to hang out and watch the sunset. The distance up/down the hill from the Magic Castle should not be underestimated - it's about quarter of a mile and pretty steep all the way - allow 20 mins for a round trip to the Magic Castle. They do offer a shuttle but we didn't take them up on this. You can use the faclities at the Magic Castle Hotel, but given the walk, it's best to treat this as an optional bonus rather than an integral part of what you're paying for. Breakfast at the Magic Castle is a reasonable help-yourself selection of cereal and pastries, fruit, juice and coffee. Worth popping in your way out in the morning, but questionable whether it is worth walking up and down the hill for. All in all, worth it for the great views over LA and a quirky and memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with home comforts!”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyDeeelite
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hollywood Hills Hotel and it was a very nice place. The views were fantastic, though the walk up to the hotel can be a bit taxing (they do offer a shuttle but we needed the exercise!) The room was clean and had a nice little kitchen (with dishes and cookware, as well as a microwave.) The bed was very comfy (with a nice view of the Hollywood Hills.) The balcony was HUGE and we enjoyed out coffee every morning with a few hummingbirds flying by. They do offer a continental breakfast (scones, toast, juice) which is nice. I wish they would have offered Wi-Fi in our room but it is only available in the Magic Castle Hotel (by the way, this is where you check in for the Hollywood Hills Hotel and also were they offer the continental breakfast.) The hotel is near Hollywood Boulevard and the Highland/Hollywood Metro Stop. A couple quick hints, Griffith Observatory offers a shuttle on the weekends from the Sunset & Vine stop (and it is only 25 cents.) Also, the LA Philharmonic practices at the Hollywood Bowl on Tues and Thurs in the summer and it is free to the public (I think they start around 10:00 am.) Overall, a very nice place to stay. We highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Hollywood !!”
Reviews.Author: DPitches
Reviews.Content: I have no idea how the last two people gave such bad reviews. Yes, you check in down the hill at Magic Castle, no big deal. The staff was very nice and helpful.Yes, you have to get your free snacks and drinks at the front desk, no big deal, they're free. Breakfast was fine, basic continental fare, it's free! Stayed in a King Studio with a fantastic city view, excellent room, clean, spacious, well equipped. Pool was wonderful, just refurbished, very nice. Exterior of the buildings could use a little sprucing up, but not bad. Location is great, a couple of blocks from Graumans Chinese Theater, steps from Yamashiro Restaurant which was excellent. Loved it !!

Reviews.Title: “A completely honest evaluation.”
Reviews.Author: jc2001
Reviews.Content: Don't let the reviews here fool you. Yes, the location is nice. Yes, the staff is friendly. Yes, the front desk (down the hill by car) has free snacks. Yes, the views are expansive and desirable. Yes, there is a kitchen or kitchenette and the rooms are more spacious than average hotel rooms. BUT, the rooms are pitifully dirty and dumpy. The kitchen and bathroom are decently outfitted but only partially clean. Throughout the place the furniture, curtains, carpeting and all other fabric finishes are stained and ratty. The mis-matched wooden furniture is nicked, stained and sticky. Yes, sticky. The painted walls are covered in gunk that should be scrubbed off or painted over and I counted no less than 15 random hairs (obviously not mine) stuck to them. Overall, it's like you're staying at a bachelor friend's apartment that was decorated with his mother's old, dirty hand me downs from the early 90's. And he rarely cleans beyond a light vacuum and dusting. If you require the space of a small apartment for your LA stay or an outdoor balcony space with a nice view and don't care at all about the condition or cleanliness of your room, by all means, this is a value. Just don't be fooled by the reviews here apparently written by frat boys like the ones partying all night in the driveway just outside the windows of my room. If you are not bothered by the cleanliness issues or potentially loud people through paper thin windows and walls, you really should stay here for the value of the space and location.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Service and Price that can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: deeceeuci
Reviews.Content: This past Saturday I stayed at the Hollywood Hills Hotel with 7 other buddies for a bachelor party. We had 2 of their suites and I picked this hotel because of its location to where we would be eating and going out as well as the reviews I read. I went into it not expecting it to be a 4-5 star hotel however the service I received was far beyond the Hilton's, Hyatt's and Sheraton's I ahve stayed at in the past. From the moment I checked in the staff was absolutely courteous and friendly. Melissa and Terrell were awesome and before I even said anything they offered to have taxi's ready to pick us up. When the time came they called us and told us our cabs were there and off we went. They even let us check out 2 hours later (there was no way we were going to be ready and out by 11 after our night). The only problem they had was the ice machine was broken but when I called and told them so they remembered that we were part of the bachelor party and I didnt even have to ask as they sent up to buckets of ice. For any and all future weekends of mine in Hollywood this will be where I stay. O and I forgot to mention that the views of the hills are amazing and parking is not a pain and they dont rip you off for parking. I dont require 4-5 stars when I stay at a hotel because I usually just need a comfortable room and bathroom to sleep and wakeup in -- if you need all the extras like a fancy pool with DJ, and a club/lounge, and a spa, in-room massuse, or catchy name for the hotel then this isnt for you. If you want to get treated well and have a nice clean room with a great view in the heart of Hollywood and you dont care that this hotel's name is more than 1 letter or not abstract then you will be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: camrosegirl
Reviews.Content: We were in Los Angeles the last week in May and due to unusual circumstances had to stay in two different hotels that week. We stayed three days at the Best Western Sunset Plaza which was very nice but rather expensive and did not have very helpful front desk staff. For the rest of our stay we were at the Hollywood Hills which is definately an older property and could use come upgrading. That being said, the staff are the best I have ever encountered and made the stay very enjoyable. The check in is at the Magic Castle Hotel and the Hollywood Hills is located up the hill in a seperate building. I think the rooms at the Magic Castle are a little nicer but they were full for the dates we needed. They offer very accesible shuttle service back and forth and we used that a couple of times to go back and forth to the pool which was very nice. They offer free snacks and drinks which was great for our teenagers. Again the staff definately make your stay here an enjoyable experience and we would definately go back. The location is great, close to all the tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: grimmsat
Reviews.Content: As some of the other reviews stated, the rooms at the HHH could stand some updating. But, that being said, it was an incredible find and a great value. Most of the famous Hollywood landmarks are in walking distance. The breakfasts are fresh and delicious (not the pitiful excuse for breakfast that is served at many B&B's), and the staff is the most accomodating we've ever encountered - - - anywhere! Check-in is at the Magic Castle, and it's an uphill trek from there to the rooms, but the staff was always ready to give us a lift, day or night, when we were tired from a day's excursions. With the added bonus of free snacks and bottled water, and the view, this was just a great, great place to stay. The Japanese restaurant at the top of the hill was pretty great, too. Thanks to all the staff....we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Megan is the best!!!”
Reviews.Author: jessa2008
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in hotels all over the world but I have never seen more a personable or genuinely caring staff than the Hollywood Hills! Our journey began with contacting Megan as our concierge and guide to reservations, tours, you name it! She set the tone for this hotel and should be CLONED as the way people should be treated when staying in a hotel for the first time...or even on those times when you return. Thanks to Megan, we will return to the Hollywood Hills many times over!

Reviews.Title: “Great view; not ready for prime time”
Reviews.Author: mackensie
Reviews.Content: First off, I'd like to compliment the staff. To a person, they were all very accommodating and attentive and really helped to (mostly) turn around what was for us, initially, a horrible experience. I understand the pressure they must be under in dealing with the Hollywood Hills Hotel. In December, we got the news that my partner had been nominated for a Grammy award. I went to look for a hotel and quickly found the Hollywood Hills Hotel and the Magic Castle Hotel. Armed with the knowledge I gleaned from their website, I thought the HHH would be a good choice, particularly because of the view and what we perceived was the style of the hotel based on the website presentation. I called the reservations line and explained we were coming out for the Grammys and were looking forward a great experience. After a long flight across the country (and, I might add, a ferry trip from the island where we live and lots of connections), we arrived on Friday night, Feb 8. After a somewhat bewildering front desk experience (the front desk for the HHH is actually at the Magic Castle Hotel down the hill - yes, there is a pool, but use the one down here. Yes there is wifi, but it's down here, yes, there is breakfast but it's down here, etc. No mention of the Grammy nomination, something I mentioned at the reservation time. It would have been a nice touch to wish us well) off we went up at the hill (no offer of assistance with bags, finding our way in the dark, etc). Imagine our disappointment when we saw the corridor where the room door for 203 is. The pile of US Mail buckets in the hall, the darkness, everything. Once in the room, the cracked paint, the stained rug, a dresser with a drawer missing and the rest of the drawers stuck and on the way to broken. The bed was okay, but all night there seemed to be a parade of odd smells. With all the comings and going of the neighbors outside - many of the hotel units are long term rentals - we joked, but crack house did come to mind. It was pretty bad. The next day, we had errands to do: get our tuxes for the awards ceremony, get the tickets for the events, etc, so we were out of the room for several hours. Imagine our disappointment when we came back at almost 4 pm and the room hadn't been serviced. It was the last straw and it was at this point we reached out for a room change down the hill at the Magic Castle Hotel. I'm grateful we could be accommodated and I'll be typing up a good review next.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Will stay AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: tehSAC
Reviews.Content: Great service from the front desk staff, very friendly. The free wi-fi, shuttle transfer, and breakfast was also great!. View from room 306 was fantastic, couldn't have asked for a better view. The kitchen was a nice touch. Would like to see maybe an updated tv in the rooms and wi-fi in the rooms also. Had to travel to the Magic Castle Hotel to use wi-fi service, which was no big deal honestly. Bed was very comfy, and shower was excellent. Only a couple blocks from Hollywood blvd and in close driving distance to the other sites in LA. Cant wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: hollywoodswingin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hollywood Hills Hotel for 4 nights this month and I absolutely loved it. I found out about the hotel after many hours of research and ultimately chose the hotel based on the positive reviews from Tripadvisor. My main reason for choosing this hotel was to get a great view without paying an arm and a leg for a room and that is exactly what I got. Our room was #404 and the views were spectacular. The room was open yet cosy and the down conforter and pillows was a great treat. Really beats sleeping on those glorified curtains you get at most hotels. Even the tiny shampoo and soaps they give you were wonderful. Normally I just ignore those at other hotels but these were like ones you'd get in an expensive luxury hotel. The balcony was my favorite part of the room. It was big and had a table and chairs and the view was GREAT. I really can't express that enough. It was so nice to come "home" to a quiet room above the city and sit on the balcony and just relax before going to bed and waking to another day in the busyness of L.A. I also want to say how nice the staff was and how great the service was. The ladies at the front desk were so friendly and helpful and every person I came in contact with there were the same way. All in all I had a wonderful time at my stay here, better than expected and will most definately stay here again in the future. In fact, I wish I was still there! In all my years of traveling, I'd have to say I enjoyed staying at the Hollywood Hills Hotel more than any other place I have ever stayed at and believe me I've been to many hotels and many nice ones at that. Thank you Hollywood Hills Hotel for making my vacation a stress free and wonderful one!

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: joe049
Reviews.Content: Very good service, from the front desk to the people taking care of the rooms. Excellent choices for breakfast. The rooms are OK, and have indeed a great view. Only one word of caution, if you are taking a cab from LAX, tell the driver to drop you off at the Magic Castle Hotel. Otherwise, they will drive you uphill from where you have to go downhill on foot in order to get to the check-in. I will stay here again the next time I am in LA

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!”
Reviews.Author: KDUB03
Reviews.Content: What an amazing view!! We had a batchelorette party with 7-8 girls- unbelievable that none of us had ever discovered this hidden gem before- and we all live within 20 miles. Quiet, secluded and comfortable. The front desk (Magic Castle Hotel) took very good care of us- free shuttle up and down the hill, answers to all questions we had and very very friendly service. Bed is very comfortable and clean. We had a kitchen- perfect for warming enchiladas & cooling our beverages. Such a great deal for a good price. All of us will be returning soon, either for another event or individually with our spouses. THANK YOU HOLLYWOOD!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it !”
Reviews.Author: h00per
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HHH 5 days in september and I simply loved it. The staff is extremely friendly and helpfull, they helped us out several times, nothing was too much. Our room, # 116, was spacious and cosy. With a living, bedroom and balcony. It really felt like our own little home in LA. For the rate ($129) it was really the best deal we could get in LA. Location on the hill is great, you have great views. They have a shuttle service which can bring you up and down whenever you want. The pool at the hotel downstairs is rather small, the one on top is bigger.

Reviews.Title: “It's better each time!”
Reviews.Author: MissF7
Reviews.Content: In June I returned for my third visit in three years to the Hollywood Hills Hotel and I love it a little bit more every time I go.  I travel to Los Angeles often on business but when I get to choose the hotel I always pick the HHH.  This time I stayed for 11 nights and more than ever appreciated having basically a luxury apartment with hotel trimmings instead of being cooped up in a hotel room for all that time.  I also save a small fortune on room service! The hotel has two beautiful pools, one (unheated but quite warm enough when I was there) is right by the apartments but if you prefer a heated pool you can stroll two minutes the hill to the main building (the magic castle hotel).  The main building also has free wifi, which I used every day.  I stayed in a massive 1 bed suite with kitchen so I often cooked in the room and ate on the balcony and kept the fridge full of snacks.  There were two TVs in the room with millions of channels, a good safe, lots of hanging space and lovely fluffy towels and linen. For me the main thing about the HHH is the absolutely beautiful views over Hollywood from the apartment rooms.  I spent most evenings sitting on my balcony while the sun went down and it's incredible to enjoy the view of a bustling city from such a tranquil viewpoint.  There are also some very cute squirrels in the area and a friendly local cat.  It's very lush and green up there and feels far removed from the hustle of LA.  The staff are still as friendly as always and make you feel completely at home without being intrusive.  If I win the lottery I plan to move in there forever... As always, I think it's pretty essential to have a car in LA but I did walk from the hotel to Hollywood Blvd and it only took 10 minutes.  You can reach some nice bars, shops and tourist things on foot, but to make the most of Hollywood and the surrounding areas I would recommend you hire a car. I really can't think of anything bad to say about this hotel.  Not all the rooms are as amazing as the one I had this time, but they are all big and I think they all have some views. It probably isn't for you if you want the big fancy hotel service experience since they don't do things like room service or laundry but the staff are really helpful and knowledgeable about the local area.  Its perfect for the independent traveller who likes their space and privacy but enjoys amenities like a swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, smelt like gas”
Reviews.Author: jojofantastico
Reviews.Content: This was a craaazy hotel. if you can get a cheap deal then i have no hesitation in recommending it. i would think twice about paying full price. On the plus side: - the hotel staff were absolutely adorable and bent over backwards to help us out! they even gave us bags of candy and bottled water to take up to our room. easily the nicest hotel staff i've come across. - the rooms are huge! the bedroom was the biggest i'd stayed in and it came with a fully serviced kitchen, lounge room and balcony - the view, although somewhat obscured, was really great - great location! easy to explore sunset blvd and surrounding areas! on the downside: - the hotel is kind of run down on the outside, looks like a dump - the room smelt of gas but the hotel staff assured us it had been checked out and was all fine. - the view isn't all that. it's nice but it's certainly not as great as the website makes it out.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Hollywood hands down”
Reviews.Author: Writer/Director
Reviews.Content: Okay, first of all you must realize that this property used to be an old apartment building and there are still people who live there (they have rent controlled apartments). The hotel people cannot spend money doing major renovations because they have actual tenants living there. I imagine whenever the tenants finally vacate, they will do massive renovations which will result in room rates five times what they are now and sort of a "ruining" of the experience here (in my opinion). Years ago when I went to LA I would stay at the Hollywood Roosevelt in one of their poolside cabana rooms. There was something about them that reminded me of how Hollywood used to be in the fifties. Since they renovated the HR all of those kinds of great authentic Hollywood experiences were gone. Only to be replaced by all things gross and glossy mall-like any-city any-place. The HHH is the last real great place to stay in Hollywood. If you need room service, and want luxuries of that sort -- you won't find them here. But you will find the same quality linens and bed that you will get at the other over-priced hotels in Hollywood. Personally, I'd rather stop by Mayfair Market on Franklin and pick up water, food, etc., or Victor's deli for some wine and then keep them in the fridge (every room has a full kitchen) than to order the exact same things and spend more money. You also get complimentary dishes and basic pots/pans. On my most recent visit I was "upgraded" to a one bedroom suite. I honestly prefer the Studio City View because I liked that the room was more open. I thought the "bedroom" area made it more congested. The *best* thing about the hotel is the balcony and the view. NOTE: There are two types of rooms here. When you drive into the compound there are a row of rooms on the left-hand side of the road and a row of rooms on the right-hand side of the road. The rooms on the left at what they call rooms with a "hill view" and the rooms on the right are what they call rooms with a "city view." I have never seen inside a "hill view" room, but judging from how they look from outside, I wouldn't stay in them. The ones you want are in the greyish building on the right -- the city view rooms. But then again, from outside, those don't look so hot either. Never mind all that - this isn't the place to stay if you're shallow and into surface only. Easy to get a complimentary ride down the hill if you just wait to call the front desk until you're ready to go. It takes them about 4 minutes to come pick you up. The service at the HHH is great. Gretchen delivers some of the best customer service I've ever experienced. I'm very afraid of writing this review because I want to be selfish about this hotel and tell no one it's here. Because I have this horrible feeling that sooner rather than later more and more people will realize what's here and Paris Hilton, or the like, will ruin it. Also -- I'm not a budget traveller. I have no problem spending $400/night on a hotel room or $200 on a nice dinner. The reasons I love the HHH are more about the feeling - the energy - the sense of magic and a taste of what true Hollywood has to offer. If you want to feel a part of it, stay here. If you want to be destracted by glossiness and mall-like atmosphere, stay elsewhere. The HHH is for people who want to be near everything but yet hidden, out of view, nestled in a quiet place. So that at the end of the day, you can retreat. And in a city as fake and gross as LA -- nothing's better than to escape into calmness.

Reviews.Title: “very dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: dbst
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the Magic Castle Hotel previously and loved it, which was unavailable but the sister hotel, Hollywood Hills was available. So we booked it, having had such a positive experience at the Castle. We arrived after a 12 hour car trip in the dark and were quite surprised when we walked in and smelled the room. It smelled like old, musty wood-so we opened the windows and lit some candles and fell into a comfortable bed. In the morning we noticed the paint on the ceiling of the bathroom was chipping, water damage to the walls and floor, and stains on the very thin carpet. The bathroom has a thin pocket door that was dirty, the front door was dirty and the walls in the bathroom were dirty. The tub, sinks and toilet were cleaned very well. We tried to upgrade and were told the hotel was completely booked. The neighbor above us was a resident and rolled around on a chair (or something) all night. You can hear everything, including the phone ringing. If it was not for the Staff at the Magic Castle I would have rated it a 1.

Reviews.Title: “Really run down”
Reviews.Author: klausa
Reviews.Content: The location is the only good thing about this hotel. The outside of the hotel is in a terrible condition - like old, abandoned, dirty appartment building. The room was really big, with the kitchenette, but it smelled of gas terribly . Most probably there was a gas leak from the stove. The bed and the bathroom seemed very clean, but the carpet had stains, the microwave looked like it had been at least 20 years old and the same about the stove. Because of the gas smell we checked out after 10 minutes and we were given our money back with no problem. The staff people were all very nice. But the overall feel of the place was very dissapointing.

Reviews.Title: “A bit scary”
Reviews.Author: Angelcrys925
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel, and chose it because the photos posted on the hotels website were amazing, and the prices seemed quite reasonable for the area. Let me just say that the photos are not a good representation of what the actual hotel looks like. When my friend and I were driving up the hill to the place, and finally figured out how to get there, I was very disappointed. The buildings were originally apartments, and the outside has not been kept up at all. The place kind of reminded me of a place you would see on an episode of cops!! For us, two women traveling alone, we were freaked out. The inside of the room was nice, very spacious, and great view of the city from the balcony. Had we stayed in this room, I probably would have enjoyed my stay more, but we didn't, because after the first night we discovered that the heat did not work. The staff at the magic castle (who owns the HHH), was very accomodating in changing our room, but 2 minutes after stepping foot in the new room we decided to check out, that room was not at all like the first, was dirty and smelled like stale cigarettes! We packed or stuff, and went down to the magic castle to check out...the staff asked us if there was a reason for leaving and I told her that we were not at all happy with the conditions at the HHH and they knocked $100 off of our stay for the night before, and offered for us a suite at the magic castle hotel for a discounted rate. We did take the suite, and found the Magic castle wonderful. I have to say thank you to the staff here they are amazing...especially Gretchen (I believe that was her name). I think that if you get the right room at the HHH, you could be satisfied with your stay, but if you are traveling alone, or a group of women...the place might seem a bit seedy...but the Magic castle is a great alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Overall pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: alvatse
Reviews.Content: I love the location! It's only a couple blocks from the Hollywood Blvd and Walk of Fame and other tourist spots. The hotel staff was very nice. I asked for 2 sets of toilettries, and the staff brought 6 sets and more! I’d say 2 things though: 1) if you are going to rely on their shuttle service between Magic Castle Hotel (where the front desk is) and Hollywood Hills Hotel (they both belong to the same property), make sure you wait till 10 mins prior to the time you need the service. If you call too much in advance for shuttle for a particular time, they forget to pick you up. However, the cars they use as ‘shuttle’ are very nice and clean. Seems like they mostly use 4WD to pick up/drop off guests. 2) the bedding is very clean. I’m very picky about bedding but HHH has very clean bed sheets, comforter, and pillow case. Overall a very pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Only deserves 1 star (Terrible)...please read!”
Reviews.Author: washington2010
Reviews.Content: I always use tripadvisor when deciding which hotel to stay in and 99% of the time it works quite well. I just got back from staying one night at the Hollywood Hills Hotel and was immensely disappointed. The only reason this hotel deserves 1 star is because of the friendly staff. When I first walked into the room I was pleasantly surprised. The room was large with a small kitchenette area and a large private balcony. I put our drinks in the fridge, but noticed it was as warm as the room temperature. I thought no big deal since the size of the room is above average and the balcony was a nice feature. My partner and I decided to check out the pool, but ended up being disgusted by its condition. The bottom had flaking off paint and was plagued by algae. We went back to our room and turned on the A/C and took a shower. While I was in the shower within 5 minutes the water was freezing cold! My girlfriend couldn't even take one after me because it would not even get just a little bit warm. When I came out, the floor around the A/C vent was soaked! On top of that, only one light worked in the entire room! Luckily I got the room at a discounted price, but if I had paid the standard rate, I would have demanded some compensation. This hotel could have easily received 5 stars if the owners would just put some money renovating the entire property. I felt the quality of the hotel was equivalent to a Motel 8. HORRIBLE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views and Awsome Staff”
Reviews.Author: BIGFINGERS
Reviews.Content: The Good: View, Staff, Location The Bad: A little run down Over All: If you like people who will go the extra mile to make sure your stay will be your best experience in Los Angeles, then this place is for you. I highly recomend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at HHH”
Reviews.Author: wwrice1
Reviews.Content: I just got back from staying 5 nights at the Hollywood Hills Hotel (HHH). I found this gem of a hotel here at TA. It seemed to have some solid reviews so I thought I would give it a try. All expectations were met. I was in Hollywood for a wedding and needed a central location. I spent a fair amount of time in Studio City and in Silver Lake. HHH was perfect. It is just above the noise of the city. It has great views. It is part of the Magic Castle Hotel and gives you access to the MC pool and breakfast. So, I will surely stay here again and would recommend this place to my friends. Great staff, great place, best water pressure in a hotel shower ever!!!, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood Hills an A+”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is probably a little repetitive but here goes. First, the staff couldn't be better. So welcoming and helpful. Beautiful views. The bed very comfortable. They gave me a free room upgrade as I had trouble finding the right place to check in so that was nice. Parking is scary depending on where your spot is. I was a little suprised at the $8.00 a day parking fee. Room a bit worn but clean and spacious. After my first shower I took a pretty good fall on the bathroom floor which is very slippery when wet so beware!I Was confused where to check in so I'll pass on this information. Check in at the Magic Castle Hotel lobby (not to be confused with the Magic Castle Club). There you get a welcoming glass of bubbly lemonade. Nice touch. Yes you do have to walk a steep hill to use your laptop for free wireless internet or to get the yummy Continental breakfast in the Magic Castle lobby. But after two or three scones it's probably good I burned a few calories going back up! I suppose you could drive down but then where to park as it is tight in front of the hotel. Great location although it can be tough crossing the street at the bottom of the hill. But that's summer in LA i guess. All in all a great stay at a place with reasonable rates with a great location. Not to be confused with the Best Western Hollywood Hills.

Reviews.Title: “Our Second Stay Was As Great As The First”
Reviews.Author: YBM
Reviews.Content: We first stayed for a week in May of 2005 (see "Great, We'll Be Back", which we posted below from last year). We returned for another full week in May of 2006. We asked for the same suite that we had last year, and were very pleased that they were able to accommodate us. This is like our home in LA! With so many things to do in LA, this hotel is in a perfect central location... an easy trip via the local Metro station to Universal City Walk, or downtown to Union Station and Olvera Street... an easy drive to the beaches; Venice - Santa Monica - Malibu... an easy walk down to Hollywood Boulevard... and when you return, you're on a secluded hillside with a view across Hollywood to the LA skyline that makes you feel like you own the entire city. The staff is truly great. Ashley & Mary Jane quickly and courteously resolved a couple of minor issues at check-in. Gretchen is wonderful, she makes us feel so welcome; and she loves LA so much that she is a great resource if you're looking for suggestions of things to see or do. Darren, the manager, is a gentleman and a pleasure to converse with. I found everyone to be genuine and sincere (either that, or they all deserve an Oscar for being exquisite Hollywood actors). Once again our suite was clean and comfortable. I can only think of one other hotel we stay at where the bed is as comfortable as home. In spite of the unfavorable comments you'll see regarding the pool, it's actually just fine. Sure, it needs a paint job, but it is clean. The surrounding terrace with its pagoda is charming and relaxing. Admittedly, the exterior of the building is dated and somewhat tired looking, but the place is so comfortable, that's of minor concern. We will definitely return again!
